title: Stocks are vulnerable to a near-term pullback as the market overestimates a 2021 recovery, CFRA says
text: Investors should brace for a near-term pullback in the first quarter of 2021, according to CFRA's Sam Stovall.  Positive vaccine news has left many investors hopeful that the economy will reopen and recover during the summer of 2021. Stovall explained that the market now is showing signs that investors are overestimating a recovery in the economy and earnings in the second half of 2021.
